protocol_name: Isolation of phosphoproteins from symbiotic and aposymbiotic Aiptasia anemones for elucidation of the phosphoproteome
protocol_name_html: Isolation of phosphoproteins from symbiotic and aposymbiotic Aiptasia anemones for elucidation of the phosphoproteome
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"612d9","text":"The analysis of gene expression data via RNA sequencing (RNA-Seq) has become a standard method for model and non-model organisms to identify genes of interest associated with a specific stressor of physiological state. More recently, mass spectrometry (MS)-based proteomics started to become a standard method to assay the phenotype of an organism via means of its expressed proteins. MS has also become the method of choice for the study of protein phosphorylation. Phosphoproteomics targets proteins that are subjected to phosphorylation via means of their serine, threonine, and tyrosine residues. Phosphorylation is a reversible modification that plays a key role in controlling the activity of proteins as well as their function and subcellular localization.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eks29","text":"To bring MS-based phosphoproteomics to the emerging coral model system Aiptasia, we developed a protocol for phosphosphproteins extraction and generation of a phosphoproteome assay (spectral) library, a comprehensive non-redundant collection of Aiptasia phosphoproteins. Based on the assay library, we then performed accurate label-free quantification (by DIA/SWATH-MS) of the Aiptasia phosphoproteome. Our method reproducibly identifies and quantifies a broad fraction of the phosphorylated proteome of Aiptasia and is comparable to methods developed for other model systems","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5qlgu","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4ihga","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d7u27","text":"Tissue lysis and total protein extraction","type":"header-four","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8uajk","text":"Lyse anemones in 1.5 ml of lysis buffer with a Tenbroeck Tissue Grinder. Note: this step is critical for proteins resuspension and should therefore be thorough and consistent across samples and replicates","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":73,"length":131,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"34ie","text":"Transfer the tissue homogenate to FT 500\u2013MS pulse tubes for further membrane disruption at high pressure with a Barocycler set at 3,000 psi (200 bar), 30 cycles (30 min), 4\u00b0C. Alternatively, sonicate the homogenate 3 x 10 sec on ice (leave the homogenate for 1 min on ice between sonication rounds to prevent heating up and protein degradation)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7ue7l","text":"Transfer the homogenate to a 15 ml collection tube and if necessary add water to equalize the final volume across homogenates. This volume (Vol) will be used in all subsequent steps of the methanol-chloroform precipitation:","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"81et2","text":"Add 4 Vol of methanol to each homogenate. Pulse vortex and quickly spin down","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"841fq","text":"Add 1 Vol of chloroform to each homogenate. Pulse vortex and quickly spin down","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"97eji","text":"Add 3 Vol of water to each homogenate. The sample should now turn cloudy and form white precipitate","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"be769","text":"Spin down at 4,000 x g for 5 min to obtain 3 distinct layers of separation: a top aqueous layer (containing methanol, water, salts, and ionic compounds), an interphase disc (containing proteins), and a bottom hydrophobic layer (containing chloroform and lipophilic compounds)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6tq2i","text":"Remove the top aqueous and bottom hydrophobic layers, being careful not to disturb the protein interphase","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"c865e","text":"Resuspend the protein disc in 1 ml of methanol by pipetting up and down and transfer to a 1.5 ml collection tube (if necessary clean the 15 ml collection tube from protein residues with additional 200 \u03bcl of methanol). Spin down at > 20,000 x g for 1 min and carefully discard the supernatant","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"816hb","text":"Repeat the previous step","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"209bf","text":"Leave the tubes open in a SPE vacuum chamber for ~ 20 min or under the fume hood until the pellet completely dries. Note: do not use a SpeedVac at this stage, heating up causes protein degradation and difficulty in resolubilization","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":116,"length":115,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"f579c","text":"Resuspend the protein pellet in maximum 250 \u03bcl of fresh lysis buffer. Sonicate 3 x 10 sec on ice (leave the homogenate for 1 min on ice between sonication rounds to prevent from heating up). Alternatively, the protein pellet can be stored at -80\u00b0C.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3rajb","text":"Proceed with protein quantification by micro BCA according to manufacturer\u2019s instructions (suggested protein dilution 1:50). Note: for reference phosphoproteome assay library generation, 1.5 mg of total protein extract (per experimental condition) are used. For phosphoproteome quantification 500-750 \u03bcg of\u00a0total protein extract (per experimental condition) are sufficient\u00a0","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":125,"length":248,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"4AC23627B043496C988DAD428C5D35B0","id":654261,"previous_id":661431,"previous_guid":"A953C872DA674F9A91ED5C92478A03C4","section":"Methods - Reference phosphoproteome assay library generation \/ Phosphoproteome quantification"}

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"6av7v","text":"Filter-Aided Sample Preparation (FASP) (Wi\u015bniewski et al. 2009)","type":"header-four","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":40,"length":22,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"564hb","text":"Mix 250 \u03bcg of total protein extract with 200 \u03bcl of UA buffer in the filter unit (avoid touching the filter) and centrifuge at 14,000 x g for 40 min","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bi0df","text":"Discard the flow-through from the collection tube","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8dgtn","text":"Add 100 \u03bcl of DTT solution and mix in a thermomixer at 600 rpm for 1 min at 37\u00b0C, then incubate without mixing for 5 min","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"a36uq","text":"Centrifuge the filter units at 14,000 x g for 30 min","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dmt5o","text":"Add 100 \u03bcl of IAA solution and mix in a thermomixer at 600 rpm for 1 min at 37\u00b0C, then incubate without mixing for 5 min","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"c9phm","text":"Centrifuge the filter units at 14,000 x g for 30 min","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9o9md","text":"Discard the flow-through from the collection tube","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1dhgs","text":"Add 100 \u03bcl of UB buffer to the filter unit and centrifuge at 14,000 x g for 40 min. Repeat once","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8iquv","text":"Add 120 \u03bcl of ABC buffer containing Trypsin\/Lys-C (enzyme to protein ratio 1:50) and mix in a thermomixer at 600 rpm for 1 min at 37\u00b0C","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"25ek3","text":"Incubate the units in an incubator at 37\u00b0C overnight","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"e8jht","text":"Transfer the filter units to new collection tubes","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"f044i","text":"Centrifuge the filter units at 14,000 x g for 40 min","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bgghn","text":"Add 50 \u03bcl of 0.5 M NaCl and centrifuge the filter units at 14,000 x g for 20 min","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"81kpi","text":"Add 50 \u03bcl of 1% TFA and centrifuge the filter units at 14,000 x g for 20 min","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"35sbl","text":"Acidify the filtrate with TFA (2% by volume) and desalt the filtrate","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"611ts","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"url":"https:\/\/www.nature.com\/articles\/nmeth.1322"}}],"guid":"F53D6FB0234E4689858ABFA181249B4C","id":654264,"previous_id":654261,"previous_guid":"4AC23627B043496C988DAD428C5D35B0","section":"Methods - Reference phosphoproteome assay library generation \/ Phosphoproteome quantification"}

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"cvllm","text":"Peptide desalting","type":"header-four","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fhakv","text":"Resuspend the R3 resin in 200 \u03bcl of 100% ACN and load in a C18 Sep-Pak cartridge.\u00a0Note: do not let\u00a0the R3 resin dry at any step","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":82,"length":45,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"akqp2","text":"Condition the C18 Sep-Pak cartridge containing the R3 resin twice with 100% methanol (1 cartridge volume per wash)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"28hej","text":"Wash cartridge and resin twice with washing buffer (1 cartridge volume per wash)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1u1dd","text":"Load the acidified peptide\u00a0filtrate into the cartridge (avoid touching the resin)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"59okk","text":"Wash twice with washing buffer (1 cartridge volume per wash)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"61ak0","text":"Elute twice in protein low binding tubes with elution buffer 1 (~300-500 \u03bcl per elution). Note: for phosphoproteome quantification no sample fractionation is performed. Therefore, elute the peptide mixture twice in elution buffer 2 (instead of elution buffer 1) and directly proceed to phosphopeptide enrichment (step 15B) without drying the elute","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":90,"length":257,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ak4rd","text":"Completely dry the eluted peptides in a SpeedVac system and store the dry peptides at -80\u00b0C until fractionation","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"29FE501A65414827AFFF8A1755F5E68C","id":654265,"previous_id":654264,"previous_guid":"F53D6FB0234E4689858ABFA181249B4C","section":"Methods - Reference phosphoproteome assay library generation \/ Phosphoproteome quantification"}

Note: the supernatant can be SpeedVac dried and stored at -80\u00b0C as it contains TiO2-unbound and unphosphorylated peptides","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":34,"length":121,"style":"bold"},{"offset":116,"length":1,"style":"sub"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7sv2n","text":"Resuspend the pelleted beads in 80 \u03bcl of loading buffer by pipetting up and down. Transfer the resuspended beads to a new collection tube. Note: transferring to new\u00a0tubes between washes reduces contaminations with unphosphorylated peptides that adsorb at the tube's plastic\u00a0surface","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":139,"length":142,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2rt8i","text":"Centrifuge for 15 secs to pellet down the TiO2\u00a0beads. Discard the supernatant without disturbing the\u00a0beads","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":45,"length":1,"style":"sub"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"827nf","text":"Wash the beads with 80 \u03bcl of washing buffer 1, pipet up and down, and incubate on a mixer at 1,400 rpm for 2 min. Centrifuge for 15 sec and carefully discard the supernatant","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"898m7","text":"Wash the beads with 50 \u03bcl of washing buffer 2,\u00a0pipet up and down, and incubate on a mixer at 1,400 rpm for 2 min. Centrifuge for 15 sec and carefully discard the supernatant","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3uohf","text":"After careful removal of the washing buffer, place the collection tubes open in a fume hood for 10 min (or in a SpeedVac for 2-5 min) to allow complete evaporation of the solvent","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5um1k","text":"The dry TiO2-bound phosphopeptides can be stored at -20\u00b0C overnight","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":11,"length":1,"style":"sub"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"al858","text":"Elute the phosphopeptides from the beads by adding 50 \u03bcl of elution buffer and incubate on a mixer at 1,400 rpm for 10 min.\u00a0Centrifuge for 1 min to pellet down the beads and carefully transfer the phosphopeptides-containing supernatant to a new tube. Repeat the elution once. Note: make sure the supernatant does not contain\u00a0TiO2 beads, which are a source of contamination in the LC-MS","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":276,"length":109,"style":"bold"},{"offset":328,"length":1,"style":"sub"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1bh1n","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bv69g","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9n4qu","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3co0o","text":"(B) Phosphopeptide enrichment for\u00a0phosphoproteome quantification","type":"header-four","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2vn9","text":"Measure the peptide concentration of each fraction at A280 by NanoDrop","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":55,"length":4,"style":"sub"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4j7e7","text":"Bring the fractions to 1 mL with loading buffer","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"34j03","text":"Prepare the needed amount of TiO2\u00a0beads for two incubations. First incubation 6:1 beads to peptides ratio (w\/w), second incubation 3:1 beads to peptides ratio (w\/w)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":32,"length":1,"style":"sub"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2636g","text":"Wash the beads once in 100% ACN, once in loading buffer, and then resuspend them in loading buffer","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8t9g2","text":"Add the TiO2\u00a0beads to the peptide mixture at a 6:1 ratio and incubate on a mixer at 1,400 rpm for 10 min (first incubation)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":11,"length":2,"style":"sub"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"b868m","text":"Centrifuge for 1 min to pellet down the TiO2\u00a0beads","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":43,"length":2,"style":"sub"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2l1sj","text":"Transfer the supernatant to a new collection tube and reincubate it with TiO2\u00a0beads at a 3:1 ratio on a mixer at 1,400 rpm for 10 min (second incubation)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":76,"length":2,"style":"sub"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9gn7n","text":"Centrifuge for 1 min to pellet down the TiO2\u00a0beads","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":43,"length":2,"style":"sub"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ecu29","text":"Remove the supernatant. Centrifuge for 15 sec and carefully discard the supernatant","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"81ss3","text":"After careful removal of the washing buffer, place the collection tubes open in the fume hood for 10 min (or in a SpeedVac for 2-5 min) to allow complete evaporation of the solvent","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1d3e3","text":"The dry TiO2-bound phosphopeptides can be stored at -20\u00b0C overnight","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":11,"length":1,"style":"sub"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fgcag","text":"Elute the phosphopeptides from the beads by adding 50 \u03bcl of elution buffer and incubate on a mixer at 1,400 rpm for 10 min.\u00a0Centrifuge for 1 min to pellet down the beads and carefully transfer the phosphopetides-containing supernatant to a new tube. steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"d7vtl","text":"A variety of open source (TPP, OpenSWATH, DIA-Umpire) as well as commercially available software (Sprectronaut Pulsar X) can be used for assay (spectral) library generation and quantification of SWATH-MS\u00a0data. It is recommended to use peptide\u00a0search\u00a0engines that perform analysis of post-translational modifications (PTMs). When analyzing phosphorylation, it is important to set it as a variable modification on serine, threonine, and tyrosine residues (STY +80). Refer to Schubert et al. 2015, Tsou et. 2015, and Rosenberger et al. 2017 for the open source pipelines or to Biognosys for the Sprectronaut Pulsar X integrated workflow","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":473,"length":20,"key":0},{"offset":495,"length":13,"key":1},{"offset":514,"length":23,"key":2},{"offset":592,"length":21,"key":3}],"data":[]},{"key":"ar8e1","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"url":"https:\/\/www.nature.com\/articles\/nprot.2015.015"}},{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"url":"https:\/\/www.nature.com\/articles\/nmeth.3255"}},{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"url":"https:\/\/www.nature.com\/articles\/nbt.3908"}},{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"url":"https:\/\/biognosys.com\/shop\/spectronaut-pulsar-x"}}],"guid":"D7D711546B254730987149343792BA36","id":655773,"previous_id":655061,"previous_guid":"5030E23985F14E9DB0F4736C4A703110","section":"Methods - Data analysis"}
